question: Given below are two statements.
Statement-I: Adiabatic work done is positive when work is done on the system and internal energy of the system increases.
Statement-II: No work is done during free expansion of an ideal gas.
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer.
choices: Both statements - I and Statement - II are false
Statement - I is true but statement - II is false
Statement - I is false but statement - II is true
Both statements - I and Statement - II are true
explanation: For adiabatic process, <katex>$q=0$</katex>. Work done on the system increases <katex>$\Delta U$</katex> (<katex>$\Delta U = W$</katex>).
Free expansion means expansion against zero external pressure, so <katex>$W = -P_{ext}\Delta V = 0$</katex>.
